security_audit.summary: This skill consists of documentation and three Python utility scripts for QA tasks. The scripts use only Python standard library modules (os, sys, json, argparse, pathlib) to validate paths, read directories, and output results. No network calls, no subprocess execution, no obfuscation. Filesystem access is limited to user-specified paths. Appropriate for a testing/QA tool.

content.user_title: Generate tests and analyze code coverage
content.value_statement: Manual test creation and inconsistent coverage leave bugs undetected. This skill provides automated test suite generation, coverage analysis, and E2E testing scaffolding for consistent quality assurance across React, Next.js, and Node.js projects.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive test suites for React, Next.js, and Node.js applications
Analyze code coverage and identify untested code paths
Scaffold end-to-end test structures with industry best practices
Provide testing strategy recommendations and patterns
Output results as JSON for integration with CI/CD pipelines
limitations: Does not execute tests or modify source code directly
Does not integrate with specific CI/CD platforms
Does not perform security vulnerability scanning

prompt_templates.title: Generate unit tests
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating tests for a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-qa skill to generate unit tests for my React component at [path/to/component]. Include tests for props, state changes, and error conditions.

prompt_templates.title: Check coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the coverage analyzer from senior-qa on my project at [path/to/project] and show me which files need more tests.

prompt_templates.title: Setup E2E tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the E2E test scaffolder from senior-qa to create a test structure for my Next.js application. Include authentication and API testing patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Review testing strategy

best_practices: Run the coverage analyzer before committing to identify untested paths early
Use the E2E scaffolder to establish consistent test structure across team projects
Combine unit, integration, and E2E tests following the testing pyramid for balanced coverage
anti_patterns: Skipping tests for "simple" changes - even small changes can introduce regressions
Writing tests that only pass on the current implementation rather than testing behavior
Focusing solely on code coverage percentage without verifying test quality

faq.question: Which testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill generates tests compatible with Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, and Playwright for JavaScript and TypeScript projects.

faq.question: What coverage thresholds are recommended?
faq.answer: Industry standard recommends 80% line coverage for unit tests, with critical paths at 100%. Focus on meaningful coverage over arbitrary numbers.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the --json and --output flags to generate machine-readable results that can be consumed by GitHub Actions, CircleCI, or GitLab CI.

faq.question: Is my source code modified when generating tests?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates test files in a separate directory and does not modify your existing source code.

faq.question: Why does the script exit with an error?
faq.answer: Common causes include: target path does not exist, insufficient permissions, or Python version below 3.6. Verify the path and check Python version.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides a unified interface for test generation, coverage analysis, and E2E scaffolding with best practice patterns built-in. It works alongside existing tools rather than replacing them.
